tier_1_determinative.theft_or_attempted_theft: Theft of ornaments and cash from the complainant and his wife.
tier_1_determinative.voluntary_causing_or_attempting_death_hu: The wife was asked to remove her ornaments at knife point, but no grievous injury was caused.

tier_2_material.property_description: Ornaments and cash were taken from the complainant and his wife.

tier_4_procedural.case_number: Criminal Appeal No.740 of 2002 and Criminal Appeal No.580 of 2002
tier_4_procedural.case_title: Baban @ Bhal Prakash Ghanvat & Anr. vs. State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.appellant_or_petitioner: Baban @ Bhal Prakash Ghanvat, Suresh @ Shiva Vitthal Talekar, and Jaydras Ramdas Butte
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Sections 354, 392, 397 read with section 34 of the IPC
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code, Sections 354, 392, 397 read with section 34

residual_details.additional_facts: The accused were originally sentenced to 7 years of rigorous imprisonment, but the sentence was reduced to the period already undergone due to lack of evidence of grievous injury and recovery of the knife.
